title: Melbourne street is placed in lockdown in the space of two hours as suspicious package is found
text:
A second Melbourne street was placed in lockdown in the space of just two hours after another suspicious package was found.

The Bomb Response Unit were called to Little Collins Street in the CBD at around 4.10pm on Wednesday.

Photos showed a bomb squad officer, dressed heavy protective gear, opening what appeared to be a laundry bag left on the street.

Swanston Street between Collins Street and Bourke Street were reopened to traffic after the bomb squad confirmed there was no danger at around 6.30pm.

Photos showed a bomb squad officer, dressed heavy protective gear, opening what appeared to be a laundry bag left on the street

The bomb squad was called to Little Collins Street in Melbourne's CBD after a suspicious laundry bag was found

The Bomb Response Unit were called to Little Collins Street in the CBD at around 4.10pm on Wednesday

Swanston Street between Collins Street and Bourke Street are currently closed to all traffic

The discovery of the suspicious package came just hours after police were called to Lonsdale Street at 1.55pm.

They closed the street between Cohen Place and Exhibition Street for more than two hours.

Images from the scene showed an officer in full protective gear inspecting a black wheelie suitcase, found sitting outside a Spanish tapas restaurant and rooftop bar.

A spokesman for Victoria Police said officers conducted a safety check, and the bomb squad determined it was not a threat.

The busy road has now reopened, but commuters are advised to avoid the area, as traffic delays remain.

The scare comes just hours after a man allegedly left a hand grenade in the smoking area of a hotel bar in the outskirts of the city.

Police said an investigation into the suspicious package found on Little Collins Street is ongoing.

Earlier on Wednesday, at around 1.55pm, the bomb squad were called in after a small suspicious black suitcase was discovered

The suitcase (pictured) was not found to be a threat and the street the street between Cohen Pl and Exhibition St was reopened
description: A second Melbourne street has been placed in lockdown in the space of just two hours after another suspicious package was found.
authors: Alana Mazzoni For Daily Mail Australia
